comment.author: 54968992@N03
comment._content:
Is it me or are the two lads really enjoying the excursion?
They have great expressions, Mr. Currivan in particular looks very excited by being there, (plus a very contented  engine driver).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/photoken04] It's not just you. This photo gives me a yen for the open road, or open track... They look as if they're having an absolute ball!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The lads on a days outing what do you expect?  Great shot of two people enjoying themselves.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] It's hard not to imagine them going: "Wheeeee"!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: back in the early 70's, I remember certain train drivers on the old diesel MPUs would invite the kids into his driver's cabin to get a trainer driver's view. Have to say, I was once privileged to such an invitation and the driver was even so kind to share his lunch with us. That was on the way to Howth for a grand day out. Ah...such were the days! Can't imagine the likes happening these days, sad to say.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/23885771@N03] Probably not, Stu! Elfin Safety would have a caniption...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] Carol, probably not as restricted back then and maybe train drivers were kinder?
